sub_topic: Finding the inverse of a matrix
message_1:
Find the inverse of the following matrix:

$$\begin{bmatrix}
3 & 1 \\
-2 & 4 \\ 
\end{bmatrix}$$
message_2:
To find the inverse of a 2x2 matrix, we can use the following formula:

$$A^{-1} = \frac{1}{\text{det}(A)} \begin{bmatrix}
d & -b \\
-c & a \\ 
\end{bmatrix}$$

where A is the given matrix:

$$A = \begin{bmatrix}
a & b \\
c & d \\ 
\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}
3 & 1 \\
-2 & 4 \\ 
\end{bmatrix}$$

First, we need to find the determinant of A:

$$\text{det}(A) = ad - bc = (3)(4) - (1)(-2) = 12 + 2 = 14$$

Now, we can find the inverse of A:

$$A^{-1} = \frac{1}{14} \begin{bmatrix}
4 & -1 \\
2 & 3 \\ 
\end{bmatrix}$$

So, the inverse of the given matrix is:

$$A^{-1} = \begin{bmatrix}
\frac{2}{7} & -\frac{1}{14} \\
\frac{1}{7} & \frac{3}{7} \\ 
\end{bmatrix}$$
